title: 104_hr3665
content: The "Census of Agriculture Act of 1996" is cited as the short title. The authority to conduct the Census of Agriculture is transferred to the Secretary of Agriculture. The Secretary of Agriculture is required to conduct a census of agriculture every five years starting in 1998. The census may include surveys, data collection, and statistical methods deemed necessary. Non-compliance with answering census questions may result in penalties under the United States Code. The census conducted by the Secretary of Agriculture every five years requires individuals to provide accurate information. Failure to do so may result in penalties under the United States Code, including repercussions for providing false information or refusing to disclose social security numbers. The census covers various states and territories, as determined by the Secretary. The Secretary of Commerce may provide information collected under title 13, United States Code to the Secretary of Agriculture for census purposes. The information must only be used for statistical purposes. The Secretary of Agriculture shall provide information collected in a census to the Secretary of Commerce for statistical purposes only. Rules and regulations for this process may be prescribed by the respective Secretaries. Effective October 1, 1998, section 142 of title 13, United States Code, and section 343(a)(11)(F) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act are amended. The Secretary of Agriculture will provide census data to the Secretary of Commerce for statistical purposes. SEC. 3. PROVISIONS RELATING TO CONFIDENTIALITY OF INFORMATION. Information is amended regarding the authority to furnish information to the Department of Agriculture and Department of Commerce under the Food Security Act of 1985 and the Revised Statutes. The confidentiality of information is addressed in these amendments. The Food Security Act of 1985 is amended to allow the release of information under section 526(c)(6) of the Revised Statutes. Information provided under this section shall be treated as confidential for purposes of certain sections of title 13, United States Code. The Food Security Act of 1985 is amended to allow the release of confidential information under section 526(c)(6) of the Revised Statutes. Passed by the House of Representatives on July 22, 1996.
